prefix: The programme projects the debt ratio to further decline by 9 percentage points over the programme period, mainly on account of primary surpluses above 2 % of GDP.
text: The budgetary outlook, which is comparable to that of the Government and the monetary targets set in the on-going Article 155 negotiations, is positive towards surplus. Stabilisation in absolute terms is likely to be achieved by 2000, the most important year in the programme for the Community as a whole. These forecasts lead to a fall in the reference revenue of nearly EUR 200 billion in 2000, by 2002 the highest in the programme's policy programme of 2003, and the worst economic contraction for the European Union in over three years. prefix: Since then, imports from the PRC dramatically decreased while Indonesian imports decreased by a much lesser extent until the IP when these latter imports were still more than three times
reference: higher than imports from the PRC.
text: more than those of the PRC. The Indonesian imports, however, decreased considerably in volume, underselling to end users, and fell both in price and in value. One of the benefits of exporting Indonesian bananas from Indonesia to the Community was that it was freely available throughout the Community. To make their exports without imposing any more formalities, like invoicing, the Indonesian exporting producers also imported full quantities of imported bananas. prefix: (79) It should lastly be noted that the 12 members of the board of directors of each channel include two Members of Parliament, four representatives of the State
reference: and four experts.
text: , five Members of the Commission and two witnesses. Their positions on these issues have to be considered as being in accordance with the opinion of the Management Board, which therefore holds not only the majority of the votes but also the majority of the votes taken by the employees' representatives. There should therefore be sufficient time for negotiations to take place prior to the commencement of the formalities related to the distribution of votes and information. Following the disclosure of the notice, the Commission received a question and response from the Swedish Telematic Chamber of Commerce on 3 November 2004. The Chamber describes the internal structures within the management of the company in the draft Communication.

prefix: 1. The court with which an appeal is lodged under Article 43 or Article 44 may, on the application of the party against whom enforcement is sought, stay the
reference: proceedings if an ordinary appeal has been lodged against the judgment in the Member State of origin or if the time for such an appeal has not yet expired; in the latter case, the court may specify the time within which such an appeal is to be lodged.
text: enforcement proceedings for an indefinite period to prevent the disclosure of facts or documents essential to the proceedings. Such period shall not be less than one year. Whenever a party makes further statement of interest, the stay shall continue until the court authorises the party to lodge its appeal. The time limit for lodging further evidence shall be one year. It may however be reduced to no more than one year. If it is decided that the party is liable under Article 43 (1) to pay the costs of the appeal, where appropriate a judgment shall be entered against the party. The court may, however, take no decisions after the party has lodged his objection

prefix: (39) During 2003, the value of the Norwegian kroner fell by 13 % relative to the euro, by 12 % relative to the Danish krone
reference: and by 14 % relative to the Swedish krone.
text: [9]. Between 2003 and 2007 the price of the Norwegian kroner increased by 14 % relative to the euro. This in turn, raised the Community’s competitiveness by about 7 % on average. By contrast, the Norwegian kroner price from 2003 and the market price fell by 13 %. Indeed, the argument against the investor’s argument against the Norwegian kroner investor was refuted [10]. The same effect was observed for the Swedish kroner market.
